pros:
This company makes you feel at home in the office and they want you to excel in what you do/reach your goals. They also provide you with the tools and training to learn other aspects of the company in case you have other interests or would like to add more skills to your repertoire.

They have some of the best benefits and perks I’ve ever seen! The health insurance is awesome and very affordable. They also give out bonuses for referrals and for going above and beyond. It’s awesome!

Such a great environment/culture and great place to move up the chain. They also love when you have new ideas and all the managers are open to hearing them. I highly recommend!
cons: None at all - you’re great!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up!

pros: Benefits are great, great commute
cons: poor communication, no business guidelines
advice_to_mgmt: Top management must exercise independence in decision making.

pros: Radiant Solutions has brought together what used to be a group of competing companies like MDA IS, Digital Globe | Radiant, HumanGEO, GeoEye Analytics, and SPADAC to form one amazingly diverse and exciting company. There is a lot going on and so much innovative thought that it is hard to keep up with it all. This company is going places.
cons: Having gone through the recent round of mergers the HR department and over all business practices still have a lot of kinks that need to be ironed out. It seems like no one knows what the right process to get approvals is and things take longer than they should.
advice_to_mgmt: Get all the kinks ironed out with our inter-company processes so that we can focus on supporting the customers.

pros:
the leadership team here is authentic, humble, and extremely competent technically. The President is amazingly transparent, personable, and has seemingly infinite patience. The projects and products that Radiant works on and creates are cutting edge so it's great to be a part of that. Most work is done unclassified and on Radiant sites and this is a great place to work to get exposure to a broad set of things : imagery, big data, software engineering, data science, deep learning etc even NLP.
Radiant Solutions is not just a government contracting company, it is also a product company. The developers and data scientists are really great people to work with and learn from.
cons: There are no significant cons that I can think of
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you are doing, keep pushing on the product development front with a focus on AI/ML

pros: Great atmosphere and coworkers. They seem to care about their employees.
cons: Lack of work leads to a reduction in force. Better planning would help them retain more talent.

pros: Relaxed work environment at the Arlington office.
cons: Contracting gets stale, work isnt very engaging

pros: Great teams and supportive environment
cons: open desk plan which I did not like

pros:
The people specifically in the commercial side and in the Meteorology room were amazing. It was a very close group which made it particularly hard to leave. In addition, my manager and director were always extremely supportive of career growth which was very important to me and I appreciate everything they did for me. As an operational meteorologist, I learned an immense amount from the more experienced meteorologists. It was a supportive group which I believe allowed us all to succeed and I know that they will continue to succeed.

Outside of my direct group, I was an avid supporter of the Snack Wednesdays, the company holiday parties, the chili cookoff, along with other events. Dogfish Alehouse is across the street from the Gaithersburg office too which always makes for a good meeting spot.
cons: This is more to do with the requirement of my role but the non-standard hours were difficult along with working holidays and weekends at times. This comes with the job though. I also felt that the upper level management was disconnected at times from our group. There also tended to be some communication issues from upper level management at times, but this improved a lot from when I first started to when I was leaving.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to allow people to grow. I think this was the best quality I saw with my direct management that I don't think a lot of other places offer.

review_title: Not just a job, a career
years_at_company: Not just a job, a career
pros: Excellent Benefits, Care about employees, Invests in employees
cons: My issues have been addressed (without even having to voice them) in the last few years, so there are none remaining!
advice_to_mgmt: When each manager looks after their team like they are a small company of their own within the larger corporation, good things happen. We still maintain that "smaller company" feel even though we have grown so much in the last several years. It is important to empower mid-level managers to help the people under them and make sure the right people are chosen for such positions. Just because someone has been a great analyst or programmer for years doesn't mean they will be a good manager. It is also important to train and give resources to the managers who want to improve and get better for the sake of their team and the company. For the most part, I believe this is happening and it benefits everyone in the long run. It is easy to let a job fall into just punching a time clock and showing up (especially after several years), but I don't believe in that and I don't think that is what we do in this company, in my experience. Keep up the good work!

review_title: Meaningful, challenging work despite growing pains and legacy projects
years_at_company: Meaningful, challenging work despite growing pains and legacy projects
pros:
Great, supportive work environment
Flexible work hours
Education expense reimbursement (including tuition, conferences, textbooks...)

You get to do real development from the start, and the small project/team structure means you have independence to work at your own pace/strengths but you always have others to support you.
cons:
Benefits in Ypsilanti haven't caught up to those at other branches.

Communication is difficult at times due to security logistics and largeness of office space. On the company wide scale, all of the mergers transitions make communication from upper management hard to follow at times.

There is some exciting tech, but there is also a lot of legacy tech and legacy projects and IT/security concerns make updates slow.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the good work trying to organize and consolidate processes and making logistics and resources a lot simpler.

review_title: Great place to work, opportunities for employees' professional growth
years_at_company: Great place to work, opportunities for employees' professional growth
pros: Radiant Solutions has a great community of talented employees who are committed to high quality work while maintaining a fun, welcoming environment. Managers are encouraging and invested in employees' growth and help identify opportunities to learn and develop new professional skills. There have been many inevitable changes from acquisitions but management seems to be dedicated to preserving benefits that employees feel most strongly about (excellent PTO for example). A casual work environment and good communication makes for a positive workday.
cons: The growing pains of several mergers in the past few years are still being worked through.
advice_to_mgmt: Communication is the key to keeping people informed and happy.

review_title: Major Differences Between Groups, Poor Merger Execution
years_at_company: Major Differences Between Groups, Poor Merger Execution
pros: If you work at one of the old Radiant Blue groups, you are in luck - get hired there.
cons:
Core tech and scientists are leaving from groups and units where products are still valuable, but are somewhat redundant to other products. Bad merger execution still ongoing, with regional leaders seething that others are taking their product. Admin groups are not friendly, to say the least, all of them - the culture is of vultures, fend for yourself.
Lots of job opportunities and many idle employees, which should drive internal talent reuse and training for more valuable disciplines, but this is not happening.
advice_to_mgmt: Learn the meaning of transparency and apply it. Employees are not blind, the fact that you cannot figure out the org chart based on real product values and opportunities to send a cohesive message is bad for business and your employees.

pros:
Great corporate culture
Benefits package
Tuition reimbursement
Student loan repayment plans
Interesting and rewarding work
cons: No cons at this moment

pros: Work From Home Options, Multiple Office Locations, Great Health/Dental Insurance Options and 401(K) matching, Opportunity to have a lot of responsibility
cons: Still relatively new company, with recent acquisitions coming together, sometimes makes it challenging to know where to go for what

review_title: Why I’m Excited about Radiant Solutions
years_at_company: Why I’m Excited about Radiant Solutions
pros:
1) Our Mission. Every day, Radiant Solutions reveals insight where and when it matters to help our government and commercial customers understand and navigate our changing planet.

2) Our Values. I enjoy working in culture that attracts diverse talent motivated to apply cutting-edge innovation to some of the toughest problems facing our world.

3) Our Opportunity. Our strategic growth plan puts us on a path to grow revenue by double digits and grow mission impact exponentially.
cons: We are still growing through company combination as Maxar Technologies.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to 1) stay focused on our strategy, 2) put our customers mission first, and 3) create an environment where employees can do their best work.

pros: Benefits and support to employee ideas
cons: None noticed yet but i will keep looking.
advice_to_mgmt: Encourage more thoughts for free thoughts to help develop new ideas.

pros:
- Exciting high-growth, high-impact, environment. Many of the teams in the company continually exceed expectations and that has led to fast growth. We have an environment that's conducive to success and working on a successful project feels great.
- Generous vacation allotment (20 days)
- Good culture emphasizes results and gives employees space to deliver
- Long-term career-oriented culture
cons:
- Low pay compared to top companies
- Middle management is growing faster than the rest of the company, which risks consuming resources that should go towards real growth.
- There are a few bad managers who got into the company via acquisitions. Fortunately, this issue only effects and few departments, and upper management seems to be taking steps to fix it.
- Limited growth opportunities for engineers. It's supposed to be possible to get non-management promotions, but nearly all promotions go to managers.
advice_to_mgmt: Preserve the culture that makes this company successful. Keep pre-merger benefits in place and avoid taking steps that "cut costs" while eroding employee trust. Be careful about growing middle-management too fast because it could threaten long-term efficiency and growth.

pros: Casual office atmosphere, beautiful business park/campus.
cons: There are no cons at this point.

review_title: Great company to work for, highly recommend.
years_at_company: Great company to work for, highly recommend.
pros: Benefits are very generous, paid time off is unnmatched in my experience, and the work is engaging.
cons: The work can get tedious but if you are a go getter then there are always options for adding new responsibilities or completing interesting one-off tasks.

pros: Great People, Great Product, Great Place.
cons: I can't think of any.

pros: Amazing benefits: paid leave, health insurance, etc. Dynamic and diverse workforce innovating in a growing industry. Many different locations, all with unique internal opportunities.
cons: Distance from HQ can have it's cons if you're in a different office. There are slow and busy periods throughout the year, but the company certainly rewards employees after the busy periods are over!

pros: The support we provide our customers provides meaningful impact to the world around us. The focus of this work is directed at every corner of the planet requiring us to be agile and diligent in our understanding of global issues.
cons: The combined company is still in its first year and there are some combination and growing pains.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue putting people first and focusing on relationships. Maintain the vision of building a better world.

review_title: Great company with a positive outlook for the future
years_at_company: Great company with a positive outlook for the future
pros: Great work environment, particularly in the Arlington office; Room for creativity, learning, and skill building; Strong and supportive leadership team trying to improve the company while maintaining its strengths; Good benefits, including relatively flexible hours.
cons: Wouldn't call it a con, but company was recently bought by Maxar Technologies so there is a transition period.
advice_to_mgmt: Don't forget the positive qualities that small companies have and try to maintain those through the acquisition.

pros:
Relaxed work culture.
flexible time.
Working with intelligent and driven youth.
Good work/life balance.
Great benefits.
cons:

PM would show up once a week.
If started at entry level, very little room for growth.
Only a slim number of employees are lucky to be put on projects with some incredible mentors.

pros: I've had multiple opportunities within the year that I've worked for Radiant Solutions. If you put in the effort it will not go unnoticed by management.
cons: The company is currently transitioning due to a recent merger. This is a time when shifting roles and responsibilities can be expected, and should be sorted out by 2019.
advice_to_mgmt: Utilize the talent of multiple departments to benefit the interdisciplinary nature of our projects. More inter-department communication and networking.

review_title: A great company to work for
years_at_company: A great company to work for

- family oriented, inclusive
- values employee input

review_title: Want to work for a company, this is the one to work for!
years_at_company: Want to work for a company, this is the one to work for!
pros:
Flexible schedule to work with your family life.
Benefits are good for Health, Dental, Life, Vision.
Talking with management at the office that I work with is very comforting to talk to.
Wednesday Snack Days are the best!
cons: Communication could be better between the offices.

review_title: An Exciting Company to be a part of
years_at_company: An Exciting Company to be a part of
pros: For those who get the work done and choose to pursue it, there are growth opportunities awaiting them. Being an analyst can be tedious at times, but there are opportunities to step up, take on more responsibilities, or go above and beyond. You also get to work in a collaborative environment, side by side with your colleagues. Being a part of a team and offering and receiving the support of those around you is invaluable as a job asset.
cons: Management can sometimes struggle to communicate clearly with their employees. As Radiant Solutions has taken part in a massive merger over the past year, and is now part of the new space economy giant that is Maxar Technologies, there are understandable growing pains as management from the top down tries to settle in and shake out all the kinks that come with being part of a newly merged company.
advice_to_mgmt: Communicate often and clearly with all levels of employees at your company, and always be as transparent as possible.

review_title: A rewarding place to grow professionally
years_at_company: A rewarding place to grow professionally
pros: This is my first full-time job, and though I don't really have much to compare it to, I really like it so far. I am receiving a great salary and rewards, the management is very kind and understanding, there is lots of opportunity to grow, and the work is flexible and rewarding.
cons: I am a software developer, and it took me almost three weeks to get local administrator access. During that time, I couldn't work on anything important, which was frustrating. After I got the proper permissions, everything was fine.
advice_to_mgmt: Give local administrator access to software developers immediately, rather than having them submit a ticket, so they can effectively work in the first few weeks.

review_title: Rewarding place to grow your career
years_at_company: Rewarding place to grow your career
pros:
Company encourages innovation and team work
Honesty, integrity and ethical behavior is encouraged and embraced by management
Excellent compensation and benefits
Company invests in employee growth and development
cons:
Company is very large so sometimes internal communication can be challenging
Having so many offices makes it challenging to interact with other company personnel
advice_to_mgmt: Encourage and promote employee travel to other offices or customer locations. Improving employees' ability to interact with each other will help improve interpersonal relationships across the enterprise.

pros: Exciting projects to work on and great opportunity to increase skills and knowledge base. Management engages with employees and looks for opportunities to help you achieve career goals. Benefits are much better than the last places I've worked. Very flexible and accommodate your needs.
cons: After a few mergers benefits have decreased slightly, but are still much better than other places I've worked in the past.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep engaging with the employees about policy changes and keep up the open door policy for allowing us to come to you with any concerns we have.

pros: Great people and exciting work. Flexible environment that encourages creativity and growth for its employees. Autonomy to get your job done. Excellent benefits!
cons: Company is still working to build its one company brand after multiple mergers.

pros: sharp colleagues, interesting work, near bleeding edge tech
cons: security clearance required, little tolerance for stupid people

pros: Pretty decent benefits and some really smart colleagues. There are a lot of changes going on but the company is winning a lot of gov't contracts. There are some great opportunities to work onsite with clients.
cons: The company hires a lot of young people recently out of school and doesn't pay them much.

pros: Excellent staff! Professional and courteous. Radiant solutions is an wonderful place to work. The pay is fair and the growth potential is excellent.
cons: The locations are spread across the country. Fortunately with the technology that exists today, communication is easily achieved.
advice_to_mgmt: Make sure to keep employee satisfaction at high level. Don't forget the "little guy" while working to advance the company.

pros: Smart people all around, very friendly atmosphere
cons: Lack of mentoring, lack of growth potential and poor leadership. Was hired based on my degree but found myself unemployed within a year. Not sure how this company functions as I was laid off as an "at-will" analyst with many others. Would have liked honesty up-front that I could be job-less when contracts expire.
advice_to_mgmt: Don't provide false expectations to those who have loads of college debt to payoff and are really trying hard in the GS arena. I never received a bad review but was let go with about 6 others. Sad that this company appears to be purely financially driven. Where are the mentors and leaders? Where is the growth potential?

review_title: Exciting work and good people. Overall great experience.
years_at_company: Exciting work and good people. Overall great experience.
pros: The work is exciting and the benefits are great. The best part of this company are the people. We have the best and brightest. Proud to be part of this team.
cons: As a newly formed business unit, the infrastructure is still being established. While we can be clunky at times, it is still a great opportunity to create and shape something that can support the business.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep being visible. Keep demonstrating our values. Don’t lose sight of our mission.

review_title: An ethical company that lives up to their values
years_at_company: An ethical company that lives up to their values
pros:
I am finishing up an external class on Business Ethics, and the last week in the class, we had a former CEO of the Better Business Bureau Counsel come in and speak to us about the important of implementing ethical company values from the top all the way down to a company's most junior level staff. Many people in the class gave negative feedback about their current employers. I feel, on the other hand, that I have a … 

Show More
cons: Occasionally, there are multiple teams that are, unbeknownst to the other, working on a similar project. So a collaboration opportunity or two is sometimes missed leading to a duplication in work.
advice_to_mgmt: They do an excellent job of cultivating an ethical work environment that truly focuses on their values instead of just being some words on a wall somewhere. It makes me proud to work for such a company.
